Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: Feb 16, 2009 06:10AM MaryEV wrote: Hi Jenni! I have been thinking of you! Glad you are back and that your surgery went well. I only spent one night in the hospital too but I was so lucky to have a private room and my wonderful 23 yr old daughter stayed overnight with me. The nurses were angels! But it is so much better to be home. I am still sore but doing well. I am only taking the pain meds at night now and tylenol during the day. I have 3 drains and they are the only areas that hurt. I have a checkup with my surgeon today so he can remove the steri strips and check out everything.  Heal well!!! Mary

Posts.Content: Mar 3, 2009 09:21AM MaryEV wrote: I had a bilateral mastectomy with no recon on Feb. 11th and have had this buildup of fluid under my armpits since my drains were removed last Monday. I saw my breast surgeon yesterday and he did an aspiration on my left (cancer/axillary) side and removed 70 cc's of fluid. It really helped and I feel so much better. From what I can tell, this is pretty common and your surgeon should be able to do an aspiration to reduce the fluid buildup, although I am not sure how that works if you have TE. Mary
Posts.Title: self diagnosis.......seroma skippyrcis rferraris

Posts.Content: Feb 19, 2009 11:29PM MaryEV wrote: I had my bilat mast (no recon) on Feb. 11th with axillary node disection and I still have my three drains in. My surgeon wants them below 30 cc's in 24 hours. One drain was close when I saw him today, but I'd rather it stay in if I'm still draining. I am going back Monday so hopefully they will all be removed then.  Mary
Posts.Title: Drains ~ how long do they stay in????????? 2new1s ToniSkane

Posts.Content: Mar 8, 2009 09:32AM MaryEV wrote: My girls (23 and 20) were both away, one had graduated in May and the other is a sophomore in college. They live very close by each other but 5 1/2 hours from me. I had a biopsy on Christmas Eve and they were home for the holiday so they knew I was facing a cancer diagnosis. I called them the night I found out it was cancer, December 30th. I was very glad that they had each other close by, as they got together that evening for support. They have been wonderful and so supportive throughout my bilateral mastectomy and recovery. As the others said, only you know your daughter, but I have always been so close to my kids I knew they could handle it and would want to know as soon as possible. Mary
Posts.Title: When to tell daughter away in college Eliza2009 murphmort
